intro: Bupleurum postii, commonly known as the Balkan angelica, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Bupleurum postii is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
